employee

Class AddFilmController

  • java.lang.Object
    • employee.AddFilmController

  • public class AddFilmController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class gives the user the option to add a new film to the schedule. If the film has not been screened before and so is not on the database it will be added. The class contains a method to ensure the new screening does not overlap with other screenings. If it does an error message is displayed and the film is not added to the database. The admin can also see the other films (and start and end dates) displayed on the day chosen to add the new film.
    Author:
    Ned Lloyd and Sam

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       java.sql.SQLException
        Initializes controller. The table is populated with screenings for the current day and a datePicker event listener is added to view films on a certain date. The Option box is added in order to decide whether to add a new film or an existing one and boxes are added but made invisible for the duration, name and description of a new film
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • toggleControls

        public void toggleControls(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        When the user selects 'add new film' text boxes for title, description and duration and a button to add an image are made visible. If select an existing film is chosen these are made invisible.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • addScreening

        public void addScreening(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        When 'Add Screening' button is pressed if the film is already in the database then the 'FilmsDatabase' and the 'ScreeningsDatabase' are queried in order to obtain information for the film screenings on that day and the duration of the film being added. This is passed into the 'checkForOverlap' method. If there is not overlap the screening is added. If the film has not been screened before the information for the film duration is just obtained from the input form. If there is overlap the film will not be added to the 'FilmDatabase' When a film is successfully added a message is displayed to notify the user.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • addImage

        public void addImage(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        On press of 'Add Image' button a 'file-chooser' box is opened. The user selects a file and a message is displayed confirming that selection.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • compareTimes

        public boolean compareTimes(java.lang.String startCurrent,
                            java.util.Date endCurrent,
                            java.lang.String attemptStart,
                            int attemptDuration)
        Takes parameters for two films. The start (as String) and end (as Date) for one film and the the start (as String) and duration (as int) of another film. The method uses these parameters to output a boolean which will be true if the two films overlap and false if not.
        Parameters:
        currentStartTime -
        currentDuration -
        attemptStartTime -
        attemptDuration -

      • checkForOverlap

        public boolean checkForOverlap(java.lang.String filmNameAttempt,
                               java.lang.String dateAttempt,
                               java.lang.String timeAttempt)
        Takes the 'film name', 'date' and 'time' of the screening the user is trying to add. The method calls up the 'FilmsDatabase' in order to get the duration of the film. It then iterates over the other screenings taking places on this day and using the method 'compareTimes' outputs a boolean which will return true if the screening will overlap and false if not. If the output is false an error message will also be displayed to the user.
        Parameters:
        filmNameAttempt -
        dateAttempt -
        timeAttempt -
        Returns:

      • checkForOverlapDuration

        public boolean checkForOverlapDuration(java.lang.String filmNameAttempt,
                                       java.lang.String dateAttempt,
                                       java.lang.String timeAttempt,
                                       int attemptDuration)
        Takes the 'film name', 'date', 'duration' and 'time' of the screening the user is trying to add. The method iterates over the other screenings taking places on this day and using the method 'compareTimes' outputs a boolean which will return true if the screening will overlap and false if not. If the output is false an error message will also be displayed to the user.
        Parameters:
        filmNameAttempt -
        dateAttempt -
        timeAttempt -
        attemptDuration -
        Returns:

      • setTodayScreenings

        public void setTodayScreenings(java.lang.String dateAttempt)
        Takes the date the user has selected, calls up the 'ScreeningsDatabase' and adds the screenings taking place on that day to an Observable List called 'todaysScreenings'. Each time it is called the list is first cleared to ensure it only ever contains the screenings for the chosen day.
        Parameters:
        dateAttempt -
